page.title: 03Bickerstaffe Parish Church
page.content: At present, the main doors are being restored because during the Victorian period the parishoners painted the doors constantly so removing any trace of the original wood finish. The hinges are being made by a local farmer to the original specification. This has posed some problems because they were originally made by a local blacksmith and there are no longer any around.No two hinges are alike. The Alter is unusual because in the centre of its panelled front is the star of David, a jewish symbol not usually seen in the Church of England. The church is also unusual in that it has a pair of padded double doors close to the main front doors . The church has eight bells which are worked by a Clarion.These were presented by Alderman Sir S.T. Rosbotham and Lady Rosbotham in 1933.
